text:
Bette Midler has her doubts about a remake of 90s classic Hocus Pocus (Picture: Walt Disney Studios)

Bette Midler has slammed the Hocus Pocus remake as ‘cheap’.

The classic 1993 film, about three witch sisters brought to life on Halloween night, is being remade by the Disney Channel.

Midler, who played Winifred Sanderson, definitely has her doubts about the new version, telling PEOPLE she isn’t sure who she would cast as her character.

She said: ‘I know it’s cheap. It’s going to be cheap!

‘I’m not sure what they’re going to do with my character. My character is very, very broad and I don’t know who they’re going to find to play that.’

Anyone crossing their fingers for a surprise appearance from Midler or her co-stars Kathy Najimy and Sarah Jessica Parker are going to be disappointed.

Midler said it would be hard to recast her role (Picture: SNAP/REX/Shutterstock/Disney)

Despite having previously expressed interest in reprising her role with Parker and Najimy, when asked if she would make a cameo appearance in the remake for the right amount of money, she said: ‘No, no, no!’

It is hard to imagine anyone else performing I Put A Spell On You quite as well as Midler.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zaC-WDrvmUQ

The remake is still in development and is being written by Scarlett Lacey. Original producer David Kirschner is also on board, however original director Kenny Ortega is not involved.
